1.text: Shred 4 ounces (110 g) of cold cheese.

2.text: Place the shredded cheese in a separate container.

4.text: Dice up a half or full onion to give your cheese a mild bite.

5.text: Cut 1.5 ounce (43 g) of butter into small pieces for heating.

7.text: Whisk the flour in with the melted butter and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.

8.text: Mix in 2 cups (470 mL) of cold milk and whisk for 3 to 4 minutes.

9.text: Season the sauce with nutmeg, onion, cloves, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.

10.text: Simmer the sauce for 8 to 10 minutes or until it has a smooth consistency.

11.text: Mix in the shredded cheese without heat.

12.text: Strain out the seasonings if the sauce is chunky.

13.text: Serve your cheese sauce and refrigerate leftovers.
